00069 static inline bool querySamFlag(const int flag, const SamQuery toQuery)
00070 {
00071 bool query_result;
00072     switch(toQuery)
00073     {
00074     case SamQuery::IS_PAIRED:
00075             query_result=(flag&0x1);
00076             break;
00077     case SamQuery::ALL_ALIGNED_OK:
00078             query_result=(flag&0x2);
00079             break;
00080     case SamQuery::UNMAPPED:
00081             query_result=(flag&0x4);
00082             break;
00083     case SamQuery::NEXT_UNMAPPED:
00084             query_result=(flag&0x8);
00085             break;
00086     case SamQuery::SEQ_REV_STRAND:
00087             query_result=(flag&0x10);
00088             break;
00089     case SamQuery::SEQ_NEXT_REV_STRAND:
00090             query_result=(flag&0x20);
00091             break;
00092     case SamQuery::FIRST_SEG:
00093             query_result=(flag&0x40);
00094             break;
00095     case SamQuery::LAST_SEG:
00096             query_result=(flag&0x80);
00097             break;
00098     case SamQuery::SECOND_ALIGN:
00099             query_result=(flag&0x100);
00100             break;
00101     case SamQuery::FAIL_QUAL:
00102             query_result=(flag&0x200);
00103             break;
00104     case SamQuery::DUPLICATE:
00105             query_result=(flag&0x400);
00106             break;
00107     }
00108 return query_result;
00109 }

00160 inline static float gaussianSim(float x1, float x2, float sigma)
00161 {
00162     return exp(-( pow((x1-x2),2)/(2*pow(sigma,2))));
00163 }

00175 inline static bool isInInterval(int pos, int start, int end)
00176 {
00177     if ((pos>=start)&&(pos<=end))
00178         return true;
00179     else
00180         return false;
00181 }

00192 inline static bool isRegionAInsideRegionB( int A1, int A2, int B1, int B2 )
00193 {
00194     if (isInInterval( A1, B1, B2 )&&(isInInterval(A2, B1, B2)))
00195         return true;
00196     else
00197         return false;
00198 }

00210 inline static bool checkOverlap(int X1, int X2, int Y1, int Y2)
00211 {
00213     if ((X1>=Y1)&&(X1<=Y2))
00214         return true;
00215 
00217     if ((X2>=Y1)&&(X2<=Y2))
00218         return true;
00219 
00221     if ((X1<=Y1)&&(X2>=Y2))
00222         return true;
00223 
00224     return false;
00225 }
00226 inline static int overlapCount(int X1, int X2, int Y1, int Y2)
00236 {
00237 
00238     int overlap=0;
00239     int bigX=X1, smallY=Y1;
00240     if (checkOverlap(X1, X2, Y1, Y2))
00241     {
00242         if (X2>X1)
00243             bigX =X2;
00244 
00245         if (Y2<Y1)
00246             smallY=Y2;
00247         overlap =smallY- bigX;
00248     }
00249 
00250     return overlap;
00251 }
00262 inline static bool isOverlap(int X1, int X2, int Y1, int Y2, OverlapType overlap)
00263 {
00264 
00265     bool result=false;
00266 
00267     switch(overlap)
00268     {
00269     case OverlapType::OVERLAP_COMPLETE:
00270         if (utility::isRegionAInsideRegionB(X1, X2, Y1, Y2))
00271         {
00272             result=true;
00273         }
00274         break;
00275     case OverlapType::OVERLAP_PARTIAL:
00276         if (utility::checkOverlap(X1, X2, Y1, Y2))
00277         {
00278             result=true;
00279         }
00280         break;
00281 
00282     case OverlapType::OVERLAP_CENTRE:
00283         int middle = ((X1+ X2)/2);
00284         if (utility::isInInterval(middle, Y1, Y2))
00285         {
00286             result=true;
00287         }
00288         break;
00289     }
00290     return result;
00291 }

00300 inline static float getMean(const std::vector<float> & ourVec)
00301 {
00302 
00303     float sum = std::accumulate(ourVec.begin(), ourVec.end(), 0.0);
00304     return (sum/ourVec.size());
00305 }
00306 
00314 inline static float getSd(const std::vector<float> & ourVec, const float & mean)
00315 {
00316     float sumsq, sd;
00317     sumsq=0;
00318     sd=0;
00319     std::vector<float> deviations;
00320 
00321     for (auto floatit=ourVec.begin(); floatit < ourVec.end(); floatit++ )
00322     {
00323         deviations.push_back(*floatit-mean);
00324     }
00325     for (auto floatit=deviations.begin(); floatit < deviations.end(); floatit++ )
00326     {
00327         *floatit=(pow(*floatit,2));
00328         sumsq+=*floatit;
00329     }
00330     sd = sumsq/(deviations.size()-1);
00331     sd= sqrt(sd);
00332 
00333     return sd;
00334 }

00362 inline static std::vector<float> quartilesofVector(std::vector<float> inputVector)
00363 {
00364 
00365     std::vector<float> returnVector;
00366     int q1, med, q3;
00367     //quartile positions.
00368     q1=inputVector.size()*0.25;
00369     med=inputVector.size()*0.5;
00370     q3=inputVector.size()*0.75;
00371 
00372     std::nth_element (inputVector.begin(), inputVector.begin()+q1, inputVector.end());
00373     returnVector.push_back(inputVector.at(q1));
00374 
00375     std::nth_element (inputVector.begin(), inputVector.begin()+med, inputVector.end());
00376     returnVector.push_back(inputVector.at(med));
00377 
00378     std::nth_element (inputVector.begin(), inputVector.begin()+q3, inputVector.end());
00379     returnVector.push_back(inputVector.at(q3));
00380 
00381     return returnVector;
00382 };

00388 inline static std::vector<long int> quartilesSize(std::vector<long int> vectorSizes)
00389 {
00390 
00391     std::vector<long int> tempSizes;
00392     std::vector<long int> returnVector;
00393     int q1, med, q3;
00394     std::vector<int> quartiles;
00395 
00396     //quartile positions.
00397     q1=vectorSizes.size()*0.25;
00398     med=vectorSizes.size()*0.5;
00399     q3=vectorSizes.size()*0.75;
00400 
00401     std::nth_element (vectorSizes.begin(), vectorSizes.begin()+q1, vectorSizes.end());
00402     returnVector.push_back(vectorSizes.at(q1));
00403 
00404     std::nth_element (vectorSizes.begin(), vectorSizes.begin()+med, vectorSizes.end());
00405     returnVector.push_back(vectorSizes.at(med));
00406 
00407     std::nth_element (vectorSizes.begin(), vectorSizes.begin()+q3, vectorSizes.end());
00408     returnVector.push_back(vectorSizes.at(q3));
00409 
00410     return returnVector;
00411 }

00458 static inline std::string clean_WString(const std::string & input_string)
00459 {
00460     size_t cr_idx;
00461     std::string return_string;
00462     cr_idx = input_string.find('\r', 0);
00463     if (cr_idx != std::string::npos)
00464     {
00465         return_string=(input_string.substr(0, cr_idx));
00466     }
00467 
00468     return return_string;
00469 }

00487 static inline float norm_euclidean_dist(const std::vector<float> vecA, const std::vector<float> vecB)
00488 {
00489     try
00490     {
00491 
00492         int sizeA = vecA.size(), sizeB = vecB.size();
00493 
00494         if (sizeA!=sizeB)
00495             throw 10;
00496 
00497         if (sizeA == 0 || sizeB == 0)
00498         {
00499             return 0.0;
00500         }
00501 
00502         float sumErr=0.0;
00503         for (unsigned int i=0; i<vecA.size(); i++)
00504         {
00505             float euclid_Dist = abs(vecA.at(i)-vecB.at(i));
00506             sumErr+=euclid_Dist;
00507         }
00508         sumErr=sumErr/vecA.size();
00509         return sumErr;
00510     }
00511     catch(...)
00512     {
00513         std::cerr << "Crashing in sum_squared_error" <<std::endl;
00514         throw;
00515     }
00516 
00517 }
00518 
00519 /***
00520 * dist: Calculate the distance between two set of points.
00521 * Feng, J, X He, ST Mai, and Claudia Plant. 2011.
00522 * â€œA novel similarity measure for fiber clustering using
00523 * longest common subsequence.â€ Proceedings of the 2011: 1-9.
00524 *
00525 * p_ups: Maximum distance for two points to be close.
00526 * p_delta: Window when comparing points between A and B.
00527 *
00528 * return: edit distance between the set of points A and the set of points B.
00529 *
00530 * Thank you to Marc for original code
00531 */
00532 static inline float align_distance(const std::vector<float> p_A, const std::vector<float> p_B, const float p_ups, const int p_delta, float penalty=0)
00533 {
00534     int i, j, i1, i2;
00535     float dDel, dIns, dSub, distance;
00536 
00537     //d is a table with n+1 rows and m+1 columns
00538     int n=p_A.size()+1;
00539     int m=p_B.size()+1;
00540 
00541     float* d = new float[n*m];
00542 
00543     for (i=0; i!=n*m; ++i)
00544     {
00545         d[i] = 0;
00546     }
00548     for (i=1; i!=n; ++i)
00549     {
00551         float ups = p_ups; //Donc, si p_ups vaut 0, c'est comme si on l'utilisait pas.
00552 
00553         for (j= std::max(1,i-p_delta); j < std::min(n,i+p_delta); ++j)
00554             ups = std::max(ups, std::abs(p_A[j-1]));
00555 
00556         for (j= std::max(1,i-p_delta); j < std::min(m,i+p_delta); ++j)
00557             ups = std::max(ups,std::abs(p_B[j-1]));
00559         i1 = i*m;
00560         i2 = i1-m;
00561         for (j= std::max(1,i-p_delta); j < std::min(m,i+p_delta); ++j)
00562         {
00563             dDel = d[i2+j];
00564             dIns = d[i1+(j-1)];
00565             //**< Attempt a local maxima */
00566 
00567             if (ups!=0)
00568                 dSub = d[i2+(j-1)] + ((ups - abs(p_A[i-1] - p_B[j-1]))/ups);
00569             else
00570                 dSub = d[i2+(j-1)]+1;
00571 
00573             //dSub = d[i2+(j-1)] + ((p_ups - abs(p_A[i-1] - p_B[j-1]))/p_ups);
00574 
00575             d[i1+j] = std::max(dSub,std::max(dDel,dIns));
00576         }
00577     }
00578 
00579 
00580 
00581     distance = 1.0-(d[std::min(p_A.size(),p_B.size())*(m+1)]/(float)std::max(p_A.size(),p_B.size()));
00582     //printf(">%f\n", distance);
00583     if (std::isnan(distance))
00584     {
00585         std::ofstream quickstream("errorMat.txt");
00586         std::cerr << " result is Nan, here is your matrix.." <<std::endl;
00587         for (i=0; i<n; i++)
00588         {
00589             for (j=0; j<m; j++)
00590             {
00591                 quickstream<<d[i*n+j] << "\t";
00592             }
00593             quickstream <<std::endl;
00594         }
00595 
00596         utility::pause_input();
00597     }
00598 
00599 
00600     delete[] d;
00601 
00602 
00603     return distance;
00604 }

00616 static float hausdorff(const std::vector<float> & vecA, const std::vector<float> & vecB)
00617 {
00618     int sizeA = vecA.size(), sizeB = vecB.size();
00619 
00620     if (sizeA == 0 || sizeB == 0)
00621     {
00622         return 0.0;
00623     }
00624 
00625     float heightA=*max_element(vecA.begin(),vecA.end());
00626 
00627     float maxDistAB = 0.0;
00628     for (float i=0.0; i<vecA.size(); i++)
00629     {
00630         float minB = 1000000;
00631         for (float j=0.0; j<vecB.size(); j++)
00632         {
00634             float tmpDist = sqrt(pow((i-j),2) + pow((vecA.at(i)-vecB.at(j)),2));
00635 
00636             if (tmpDist < minB)
00637             {
00638                 minB = tmpDist;
00639             }
00640         }
00641 
00642         maxDistAB += minB;
00643     }
00644     maxDistAB *= 1.0/((float)vecA.size()*heightA);
00645 // Calculate Hausdorff distance d(B,A)
00646     float maxDistBA = 0;
00647     for (float i=0; i<vecB.size(); i++)
00648     {
00649         float minA = 100000;
00650         for (float  j=0; j<vecA.size(); j++)
00651         {
00652             float tmpDist = sqrt(pow((i-j),2) + pow((vecB.at(i)-vecA.at(j)),2));
00653 
00654             if (tmpDist < minA)
00655             {
00656                 minA = tmpDist;
00657             }
00658         }
00659 
00660         maxDistBA += minA;
00661     }
00662     maxDistBA *= 1.0/((float)vecA.size()*heightA);
00663 
00664     auto returnval = std::max(maxDistAB,maxDistBA);
00665     return returnval;
00666 }
00667 
00675 static inline float hausdorffTwoRegions(const std::vector<float> &  vectorA, const std::vector<float> & vectorB )
00676 {
00677     std::vector<float> returnDistance;
00678     try
00679     {
00680         if (vectorA.size()!=vectorA.size())
00681             throw 10;
00682 
00683         auto result= clustering::hausdorff(vectorA, vectorB);
00684         return result;
00685     }
00686     catch(...)
00687     {
00688         std::cerr << "in hauftsmanTwoBins, bins as not same size" <<std::endl;
00689         throw;
00690     }
00691 
00692 }
